title: How to Link Your Xbox Account to Discord for Seamless Voice Chats

steps.title: Xbox console
steps.content: Xbox console Hit the Xbox button. Scroll over to Profile & system. Hit Settings. Select Account. Hit Linked social accounts. Select Link beneath Discord. Follow the onscreen instructions.

steps.title: Discord app
steps.content: Discord app Tap your profile picture. Tap Connections. Hit Add Tap Xbox in the Add new connection section. Hit Continue. Follow the onscreen instructions. Tap Authorize.

steps.title: Discord PC/Mac
steps.content: Discord PC/Mac Click on User Settings. Click Connections. Click on the Xbox logo. Follow the onscreen instructions. Click Yes when you see the Let this app access your info? screen.

steps.title: Xbox phone app
steps.content: Xbox phone app Tap your profile picture. Tap the gear/settings icon. Tap Discord. Tap Continue. Log into Discord on the screen. Log into your Microsoft account.

steps.title: Xbox Windows app
steps.content: Xbox Windows app Tap the Windows button. Click Xbox. Go to your profile picture and click Settings. Click Link near the Discord option. Follow the onscreen instructions.

steps.title: Reconnect your Discord and Xbox profiles if you did so prior to 2022.
steps.content: Reconnect your Discord and Xbox profiles if you did so prior to 2022. Even if you’ve connected your profiles in the past, go to your Discord or Xbox settings to confirm that everything looks good, and relink your accounts if necessary. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Go to the Parties & chats tab.
steps.content: Go to the Parties & chats tab. Hit the Xbox button and cycle over to the tab, which resembles 2 chat bubbles overlapping one another.

steps.title: Hit Discord.
steps.content: Hit Discord . This option should sit beneath the “Start a party” option at the top of the menu.

steps.title: Select the server you’d like to voice chat in.
steps.content: Select the server you’d like to voice chat in. A list of all available servers will appear on the screen.

steps.title: Scroll through the voice channels and pick one to join.
steps.content: Scroll through the voice channels and pick one to join. Once you select your desired voice chat, you’ll automatically be connected and able to chat.

steps.title: Hit the Disconnect button in Parties & chats to leave the call.
steps.content: Hit the Disconnect button in Parties & chats to leave the call. Tap the Xbox button one more time and toggle over to the “Parties & chats” tab again. Then, select “Disconnect” in the “Discord” section of the menu to leave the voice call. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Join a Discord call on your phone/tablet or computer.
steps.content: Join a Discord call on your phone/tablet or computer. The call needs to be active before you can transfer it to your Xbox. You’ll need the Xbox mobile app installed for this to work properly. You can download it from the App Store or Google Play store, depending on your phone. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Transfer the Discord call to your Xbox.
steps.content: Transfer the Discord call to your Xbox. The exact process depends if you’re on your phone or computer: Phone/tablet: Swipe up. Hit “Join on Xbox.” Wait for the Xbox app to open. Hit “Transfer Audio” in the Xbox app. Computer: Right-click on the voice channel you’re in. Click “Join Voice on Xbox” or “Transfer Voice to Xbox.” Scan the QR code that pops up. Complete the onscreen instructions within the app.

steps.title: Join the voice call on your phone/tablet.
steps.content: Join the voice call on your phone/tablet. Make sure that the call is active and ongoing when you go to transfer the call. Check that you have the Xbox app installed. Without the app installed and set up, you won’t be able to transfer your call.

steps.title: Swipe up and tap Transfer to Xbox.
steps.content: Swipe up and tap Transfer to Xbox . This option will be directly beneath the voice call settings, like the “end call” button.

steps.title: Hit Transfer Voice in the Xbox app.
steps.content: Hit Transfer Voice in the Xbox app. The Xbox app should open automatically, and this option will be in green.

steps.title: Go to Discord in the Parties & chats tab.
steps.content: Go to Discord in the Parties & chats tab. You can access this tab by hitting the Xbox button and pulling up the Guide menu.

steps.title: Join the voice chat of your choice.
steps.content: Join the voice chat of your choice. Choose the server you’d like to stream in, as well as the individual voice channel.

steps.title: Hit Stream your game and Start Stream.
steps.content: Hit Stream your game and Start Stream . If you have a premium Discord membership (Discord Nitro), you’ll have the option to customize your stream quality before going live.

steps.title: Select Stop streaming option when you’re ready to stop.
steps.content: Select Stop streaming option when you’re ready to stop. You can find this option back in the “Discord” section of the “Parties & chats” tab of the Guide menu. [4] X Research source

steps.title: There are a few common reasons why you can't transfer a call to Xbox.
steps.content: There are a few common reasons why you can't transfer a call to Xbox. Remote features are not enabled. If you can't transfer voice calls from Discord to your Xbox console, "remote features" may be disabled: [5] X Research source Press the Xbox button on your controller. Go to Profile & system > Settings > Device & Connections > Remote features . Select the checkbox for "Enable remote features." Select Sleep under "Power options." An update is needed . Check your Settings and confirm that your Xbox has the latest update installed: [6] X Research source Press the Xbox button to open the guide. Go to Profile & system > Settings > System > Updates . If you see Console update available , select it to update your Xbox.

steps.title: If you can't link your accounts, try another linking method.
steps.content: If you can't link your accounts, try another linking method. For example, if the Xbox route is giving you trouble, try linking your accounts via Discord instead. If you’re still running into trouble, the Xbox support team recommends contacting Discord Support . [7] X Research source

steps.title: Audio problems on Discord usually have a few common causes.
steps.content: Audio problems on Discord usually have a few common causes. Incorrect sound output or input. If you can't hear anything in the voice chat or others cannot hear you at all, the wrong input and/or output may be set. In your Discord voice settings, select the correct microphone under "Input device," and the correct speaker/sound device under "Output device" and adjust the volume sliders as needed. [8] X Research source Noise suppression is off. If others can hear you a little bit but not well, or you're having trouble hearing others clearly, try enabling noise suppression in your Discord voice channel under Parties & chats > Options > Noise suppression . Other Discord-specific sound issues. If you’re running into other specific Discord-related audio issues, check out our tutorials for a mic not picking up sound or echoing issues .
